meanings.definition: Kaolines: a fine white clay used in ceramics and refractories.
meanings.sent1: The potter molded the kaolines into a beautiful vase.
meanings.sent2: The factory imported kaolines to make high-quality porcelain.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child pretended the kaolines were snow and had a mini snowball fight.
meanings.sent4: Her skin was as smooth as kaolines after using a luxurious face mask.
meanings.sent5: The artist's hands were covered in kaolines as she sculpted a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: Kaolines: a type of mineral used in the production of paper and rubber.
meanings.sent1: The factory extracted kaolines to make paper for books.
meanings.sent2: Rubber manufacturers rely on kaolines for their production process.
meanings.sent3: The magician's hat was filled with kaolines instead of rabbits!
meanings.sent4: Her words were as light and delicate as kaolines floating in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The classroom was filled with the smell of freshly printed papers made from kaolines.
